comment: Do not take a class from Koskovich. He takes his own failings out on his students. Does not know the material. Lazy and rude. Does not give back graded homework or exams, making it impossible to learn from mistakes. He gives you no clue on how you're doing in the class. I know he graded assignments incorrectly. I'm appalled he's still employed.
Who ever said Koskovich was " just fine" is wrong. Cant believe koskovich is on payroll
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: Koskovich doesn't explain concepts well and gets annoyed when students struggle. His lectures are minimal and unclear. I got a B in statics at another school, but his teaching muddied what I had learned. He rarely worked through problems, leaving anyone without time for the TA review sessions unprepared for tests.

Did not know the material he was supposed to be teaching. Didn't reply to emails. Graded the midterm "based on how he was feeling at the time." We probably spent more time trying to teach ourselves the content than doing studio work. He should spend more time focusing on teaching than posting grainy political stuff and feet pics on Instagram.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Test heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I never wore my seatbelt while driving to his class because I wanted to crash before making it to his class. Maybe then he wouldn't be so biased towards select students and realize his teaching skills need to be worked on. If you want any chance on passing this class don't take Koskovich. He is a funny guy but a really really bad teacher. Amen.
Felt this rating was fair only after he ruined my semester :)
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: There's a saying in life.. it goes,” Leave the football, before the football leaves you”. Koskovich, take a hint and listen. It's time to hang your teaching license, because you can't teach!!!! Not fit to teach, unnecessary amount of stress on students. No remorse for students what so ever, just doesn't care! AVOID!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: Having this professor was an eye opener to truly how bad a professor can teach, plays favorites to students and bias opinions to those he likes, only good thing i can say about this class is when it ended, AVOID MR.KOSKOVICH AT ALL COSTS. I knew it wasn't just me when i knew about 99% of the class had a low grade or borderline failing it.

If you thought lectures were boring wait till you take this guy. He's like NyQuil the way he'll put your butt to sleep! This guy should not be teaching at KSU. Unprofessional, insensitive, unable to teach!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Amazing lectures

comment: It is inspiring how poor this man teaches, if you thought you've experienced anything worse.. wait till you take him! Avoid his class at all cost! Won't respond to emails. Gate keeps homework grades. Plays favorites as well.. biggg time.
This is not a good professor for studio or structures. I advise you avoid taking this professor, he is not fit to teach.

He is not a good structures professor, he never actually graded anyhting other than the midterm and only put final grades into OWL Express. He got a bit better but didn't really know exactly what he was teaching at the beginning of the class. Also never posts keys, takes forever to post lecture slides, and doesn't respond to emails.

He is an okay professor, but in terms of feedback he constantly contradicts himself. He will tell you to do something, and when jurors don't like it, he will backtrack as if he didn't tell you to do it. But he is very graceful with grading, and open-minded about designs and your creative direction.

he was not very helpful if you were not liked by him. his critique was vague if he didnt like you. his instructions were broad and he gets annoyed very easily. not very nice. late and leaves early. not good for studio 1. taking him will make your first year a lot more confusing and harder than need be.
He is a great first-year professor. He really cares about your work and will come up to you personally just to review your work and talk about it.

A great professor to have for your first year. Very personable and really chill if you dont slack off all the time. His pet peeve is attendance so make sure you go to class (as long as youre there thats all he cares about).
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Skip class? You won't pass.--Hilarious

comment: He was my favorite, he was a massive W, and is very intellectual. W class, W architect, W outfits, W brain.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader
